Automating the Learning Schedule for Students via Chatbots

A learning guide that reminds when to study and motivates you

CLIENT PAGALGUY - MUMBAI, INDIA (I worked for this company 2 years back so, the product itself has changed in due course)

THE CHALLENGE

Automating the personal coach with a chatbot who can prepare and help students to remain on their study schedule

RESULTS

The company saw increase in the paid online course registrations which provided this automated chatbot

Concept

Prepathon (now Oheyo) is a platform having courses on various entrance exams in India. Initially, prepathon had a team of coaches who would help students to answer questions and guide students in their courses.

Prior Research

Feedback form students showed that a lot of students study at night and do not receive answers to their questions. They expected the coaches to be available 24X7.

We came up with the idea of using four kinds of chatbots to aid in students study preparation. This was carried out as a design sprint exercise among a team of three designers. I was responsible for the Study Plan bot.

Visual Designs

SCENARIO 1: Students are notified about the weekly schedule. They can choose the difficulty of pace

SCENARIO 2: When the app is not open, a notification is sent to the phone with an action buttion to get the user started

SCENARIO 3: Reduce the mesages to once a day if user is inactive for 3 days

SCENARIO 4: When the user is on a different part of app, the notification is presented in-app

SCENARIO 5: We would send a message if some topic is left by the student unfinished

SCENARIO 6: When the student completes an exercise, the studybot suggests them a new exercise

SCENARIO 7: Change of pace - If the student is unable to complete the suggested topics for three consecutive days then the studybot suggests to slow down the pace

SCENARIO 8: Within the homepage of the course, topics are also suggested as recommendations to the students
